titlestmt.titleproper: Lukens Gulf Cypress Company Board of Directors minute book 1901-1927
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Lukens Gulf Cypress Company Board of Directors minute book
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: The Lukens Gulf Cypress Company was a lumber firm operated by the Lukens brothers. The firm's offices were at 809 North Delaware Avenue in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The brothers were officers of the firm: Ephraim C. Lukens was president, David L. Lukens was vice president, Samuel C. Lukens was treasurer, and William B. Lukens was secretary.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of meeting minutes of the Board of Directors of the Lukens Gulf Cypress Company, 1901-1925. The minutes include financial reports.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.
